Off Peak Fares in Effect thru Sunday

Saturday & Sunday, Nov. 28 & 29, off-peak fares are in effect - including the Railroad's Family Fare discounted ticket. That means kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.
Purchase Round-Trip LIRR Tickets and Metro/Cards in Advance
Save time and money when traveling this weekend weekend -- buy round-trip LIRR tickets and MetroCards before boarding trains.

Regular Weekday Schedule Today, Black Friday
Today, Black Friday, one of the busiest shopping days of the year, the LIRR is running on a regular weekday schedule, but off-peak fares will be in effect all day.
Off Peak Fares in Effect thru Sunday

Now thru Sunday, Nov. 29, off-peak fares are in effect - including the Railroad's Family Fare discounted ticket. That means kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.

Only Turkeys trot, but every Thanksgiving those in the know take Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service! On Thanksgiving Day, (Thursday, November 26), a holiday weekend schedule will be in effect on both lines. On the Port Jervis Line for those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a 6:22 AM departure from Port Jervis arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM), and to get home, there's a 12:13 PM departure from Hoboken (12:07 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 27, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://bit.ly/1QKR9gy See a current timetable or visit www.njtransit.com or http://bit.ly/1pqFXEe for train times. Have a happy and safe Thanksgiving Holiday!

On the Port Jervis Line for those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a 6:22 AM departure from Port Jervis arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM), and to get home, there's a 12:13 PM departure from Hoboken (12:07 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 27, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://bit.ly/1QKR9gy See a current timetable or visit www.njtransit.com or http://bit.ly/1pqFXEe for train times. Have a happy and safe Thanksgiving Holiday!

Metro-North's special Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable is in effect through Sunday, November 29. On Thanksgiving (Thursday, November 26), we have additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. On the Day after Thanksgiving (Friday, November 27), we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional trains inbound in the AM and outbound in the PM. On Saturday, November 28 and Sunday, November 29 we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See full details at http://bit.ly/1Mda9iy Pick up a Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable in Grand Central or at our outlying stations. You can also find train times on our schedules page (http://bit.ly/1arccwk) Have a happy and safe Thanksgiving Holiday!

LIRR Operates on Holiday Schedule Thanksgiving Day, Nov. 26

LIRR is operating on a Holiday schedule today, Thanksgiving Day, supplemented by 17 extra trains for those attending the Thanksgiving Day Parade or visiting families - including 6 extra westbound trains starting at 6:01 AM and 11 extra eastbound trains from Penn Station starting at 11:35 AM. Cars will be added to select trains to accommodate holiday travelers. See http://bit.ly/1I20GxX for details.
Long Beach Westbound Train 11 Minutes Late
The 5:06AM train from Long Beach due Penn at 6:03AM is operating 11 minutes late due to earlier police activity near Lynbrook.
Off Peak Fares in Effect Thursday thru Sunday

Starting today thru Sunday, Nov. 29, off-peak fares are in effect - including the Railroad's Family Fare discounted ticket. That means kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.

Only Turkeys trot, but every Thanksgiving those in the know take Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service! On Thanksgiving Eve (Wednesday, November 25), check for early Getaway service on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines. On Thanksgiving Day, (Thursday, November 26), a holiday weekend schedule will be in effect on both lines. On the Port Jervis Line for those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a 6:22 AM departure from Port Jervis arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM), and to get home, there's a 12:13 PM departure from Hoboken (12:07 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 27, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://bit.ly/1QKR9gy See a current timetable or visit www.njtransit.com or http://bit.ly/1pqFXEe for train times. Have a happy and safe

Only Turkeys trot, but every Thanksgiving those in the know take Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service!

Metro-North's special Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable is in effect Thursday, November 26 through Sunday, November 29. Also, on Wednesday, November 25, early getaway trains begin departing Grand Central at 12:58 PM. See a regular timetable for details. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. On Thanksgiving (Thursday, November 26), we have additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. On the Day after Thanksgiving (Friday, November 27), we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional trains inbound in the AM and outbound in the PM. On Saturday, November 28 and Sunday, November 29 we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See full details at http://bit.ly/1Mda9iy Pick up a Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable in Grand Central or at our outlying stations. You can also find train times on our schedules page (http://bit.ly/1arccwk) or on our new MNR Train Time A

Port Jervis Line Weekend Busing Accommodates Right-of-Way Improvements

Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman on the following dates: Friday, November 13 to Sunday, November 15 Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22 All buses will follow train schedules. From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. All train service will resume (in both directions) on Sunday nights starting with the 10:55 PM from Harriman (9:14 PM from Penn Station-NY). Substitute busing is taking place to accommodate bridge deck and switch work at Salisbury Mills and Campbell Hall. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Port Jervis Line Weekend Busing Accommodates Right-of-Way Improvements

Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22. All buses will follow train schedules. From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. All train service will resume (in both directions) on Sunday nights starting with the 10:55 PM from Harriman (9:14 PM from Penn Station-NY). Substitute busing is taking place to accommodate bridge deck and switch work at Salisbury Mills and Campbell Hall. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Port Jervis Line Weekend Busing Accommodates Right-of-Way Improvements

Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman on the following dates: Friday, November 13 to Sunday, November 15 Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22 All buses will follow train schedules. From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. All train service will resume (in both directions) on Sunday nights starting with the 10:55 PM from Harriman (9:14 PM from Penn Station-NY). Substitute busing is taking place to accommodate bridge deck and switch work at Salisbury Mills and Campbell Hall. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Devon Transfer Closes On November 16, New Timetable to be Issued

Waterbury Branch customers will no longer need to change trains at Devon Transfer beginning Monday, November 16. A new New Haven Line schedule will be issued for that date. Waterbury Branch customers who transferred to trains at Devon will resume making their transfer at Bridgeport once the new schedule goes into effect. Also look for minor adjustments to some train times. Be sure to pick up a new Nov. 16 timetable at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times. We appreciate your patience during the recent infrastructure improvements to Devon Bridge.
Hudson Line Weekend Construction Schedule Ends November 15

The special Hudson Line weekend construction schedule requiring some customers to change trains at Marble Hill and Croton Harmon will no longer be in effect after Sunday, November 15. Regular weekend train service will resume and a new Hudson Line schedule effective November 16 will be issued. Be sure to pick a new timetable up at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times.

Port Jervis Line Weekend Busing Accommodates Right-of-Way Improvements

Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman on the following dates: Friday, November 13 to Sunday, November 15 Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22 All buses will follow train schedules. From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. All train service will resume (in both directions) on Sunday nights starting with the 10:55 PM from Harriman (9:14 PM from Penn Station-NY). Substitute busing is taking place to accommodate bridge deck and switch work at Salisbury Mills and Campbell Hall. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Devon Transfer Closes On November 16, New Timetable to be Issued

Waterbury Branch customers will no longer need to change trains at Devon Transfer beginning Monday, November 16. A new New Haven Line schedule will be issued for that date. Waterbury Branch customers who transferred to trains at Devon will resume making their transfer at Bridgeport once the new schedule goes into effect. Also look for minor adjustments to some train times. Be sure to pick up a new Nov. 16 timetable at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times. We appreciate your patience during the recent infrastructure improvements to Devon Bridge.
Hudson Line Weekend Construction Schedule Ends November 15

The special Hudson Line weekend construction schedule requiring some customers to change trains at Marble Hill and Croton Harmon will no longer be in effect after Sunday, November 15. Regular weekend train service will resume and a new Hudson Line schedule effective November 16 will be issued. Be sure to pick a new timetable up at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times.
Waterbury Branch train service will be replaced by bus service in both directions due to an earlier train with mechanical difficulties. Please listen for announcements at your station.

Planned work: New Traffic Pattern: Beginning tonight, Friday, November 13, Manhattan-bound traffic exiting from Robert F. Kennedy Bridge to E.125 Street, will be shifted onto a temporary ramp. The shift and traffic diversion to the adjacent temporary ramp will take place starting tonight at 9:00 p.m. In addition for a 15-minute period between 1:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m., the RFK Bridge Harlem span will be closed to all traffic to accommodate this operation. Motorists will experience delays and are advised to allow extra travel time, or consider alternate routes during the overnight period as this vital work commences. Motorists are urged to sign up for MTA e-mail/text alerts or to check the Service Status box at www.mta.info for the latest information on closures and planned work at MTA's seven bridges and two tunnels.

Hudson Line Weekend Construction Schedule Ends November 15

The special Hudson Line weekend construction schedule requiring some customers to change trains at Marble Hill and Croton Harmon will no longer be in effect after Sunday, November 15. Regular weekend train service will resume and a new Hudson Line schedule effective November 16 will be issued. Be sure to pick a new timetable up at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times.
Devon Transfer Closes On November 16, New Timetable to be Issued

Waterbury Branch customers will no longer need to change trains at Devon Transfer beginning Monday, November 16. A new New Haven Line schedule will be issued for that date. Waterbury Branch customers who transferred to trains at Devon will resume making their transfer at Bridgeport once the new schedule goes into effect. Also look for minor adjustments to some train times. Be sure to pick up a new Nov. 16 timetable at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times. We appreciate your patience during the recent infrastructure improvements to Devon Bridge.
Port Jervis Line Weekend Busing Accommodates Right-of-Way Improvements

Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman on the following dates: Friday, November 13 to Sunday, November 15 Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22 All buses will follow train schedules. From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. All train service will resume (in both directions) on Sunday nights starting with the 10:55 PM from Harriman (9:14 PM from Penn Station-NY). Substitute busing is taking place to accommodate bridge deck and switch work at Salisbury Mills and Campbell Hall. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Planned work: New Traffic Pattern: Beginning tonight, Friday, November 13, Manhattan-bound traffic exiting from Robert F. Kennedy Bridge to E.125 Street, will be shifted onto a temporary ramp. The shift and traffic diversion to the adjacent temporary ramp will take place starting tonight at 9:00 p.m. In addition for a 15-minute period between 1:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m., the RFK Bridge Harlem span will be closed to all traffic to accommodate this operation. Motorists will experience delays and are advised to allow extra travel time, or consider alternate routes during the overnight period as this vital work commences. Motorists are urged to sign up for MTA e-mail/text alerts or to check the Service Status box at www.mta.info for the latest information on closures and planned work at MTA's seven bridges and two tunnels.

Devon Transfer Closes On November 16, New Timetable to be Issued

Waterbury Branch customers will no longer need to change trains at Devon Transfer beginning Monday, November 16. A new New Haven Line schedule will be issued for that date. Waterbury Branch customers who transferred to trains at Devon will resume making their transfer at Bridgeport once the new schedule goes into effect. Also look for minor adjustments to some train times. Be sure to pick up a new Nov. 16 timetable at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times. We appreciate your patience during the recent infrastructure improvements to Devon Bridge.
Port Jervis Line Weekend Busing Accommodates Right-of-Way Improvements

Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman on the following dates: Friday, November 13 to Sunday, November 15 Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22 All buses will follow train schedules. From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. All train service will resume (in both directions) on Sunday nights starting with the 10:55 PM from Harriman (9:14 PM from Penn Station-NY). Substitute busing is taking place to accommodate bridge deck and switch work at Salisbury Mills and Campbell Hall. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. Waterbury Branch customers will no longer need to change trains at Devon Transfer beginning Monday, November 16. A new New Haven Line schedule will be issued for that date. Waterbury Branch customers who transferred to trains at Devon will resume making their transfer at Bridgeport once the new schedule goes into effect. Be sure to pick up a new Nov. 16 timetable at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times. Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman on the following dates: Friday, November 6 to Sunday, November 8 Friday, November 13 to Sunday, November 15 Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22 All buses will follow train schedules. Devon Transfer Closes On November 16, New Timetable to be Issued

Waterbury Branch customers will no longer need to change trains at Devon Transfer beginning Monday, November 16. A new New Haven Line schedule will be issued for that date. Waterbury Branch customers who transferred to trains at Devon will resume making their transfer at Bridgeport once the new schedule goes into effect. Also look for minor adjustments to some train times. Be sure to pick up a new Nov. 16 timetable at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times. We appreciate your patience during the recent infrastructure improvements to Devon Bridge.

Port Jervis Line Weekend Busing Accommodates Right-of-Way Improvements

Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman on the following dates: Friday, November 6 to Sunday, November 8 Friday, November 13 to Sunday, November 15 Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22 All buses will follow train schedules. From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. All train service will resume (in both directions) on Sunday nights starting with the 10:55 PM from Harriman (9:14 PM from Penn Station-NY). Substitute busing is taking place to accommodate bridge deck and switch work at Salisbury Mills and Campbell Hall. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Devon Transfer Closes On November 16, New Timetable to be Issued

Waterbury Branch customers will no longer need to change trains at Devon Transfer beginning Monday, November 16. A new New Haven Line schedule will be issued for that date. Waterbury Branch customers who transferred to trains at Devon will resume making their transfer at Bridgeport once the new schedule goes into effect. Also look for minor adjustments to some train times. Be sure to pick up a new Nov. 16 timetable at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times. We appreciate your patience during the recent infrastructure improvements to Devon Bridge.
Hudson Line Weekend Construction Schedule Ends November 15

The special Hudson Line weekend construction schedule requiring some customers to change trains at Marble Hill and Croton Harmon will no longer be in effect after Sunday, November 15. Regular train service will resume and a new November 16 Hudson Line schedule will be issued. Be sure to pick a new timetable up at your station or in Grand Central, or see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm for train times.

N Line - UPDATED Weekday Planned Service Change

The following planned service change is ADDED: 9:45 AM to 3 PM, Tue to Fri, Nov 3 - 6 Astoria-bound N trains are rerouted via the D express from Stillwell Av to 36 St. Trains stop at Bay 50 St, 62 St-New Utrecht Av, and 9 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, Bay Pkwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, Fort Hamilton Pkwy, and 8 Av, take the N to 62 St-New Utrecht Av or 36 St and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. Port Jervis Line Weekend Busing Accommodates Right-of-Way Improvements

Weekend busing (from Fri. night through Sun. night) will occur on the Port Jervis Line in both directions between Port Jervis and Harriman on the following dates: Friday, November 6 to Sunday, November 8 Friday, November 13 to Sunday, November 15 Friday, November 20 to Sunday, November 22 All buses will follow train schedules. From Harriman: Buses will substitute for trains starting Friday nights with the 11:30 PM train. From Port Jervis: Buses will substitute for trains beginning Friday nights with the 9:27 PM train. All train service will resume (in both directions) on Sunday nights starting with the 10:55 PM from Harriman (9:14 PM from Penn Station-NY). Substitute busing is taking place to accommodate bridge deck and switch work at Salisbury Mills and Campbell Hall. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Weekend Busing On Pascack Valley Line, Sat., Oct. 31-Sun., Nov. 1

Buses will substitute for trains on the Pascack Valley Line between Spring Valley and Secaucus Junction for the entire weekend of Sat., Oct. 31-Sun., Nov. 1. This service change is taking place to accommodate scheduled grade crossing repairs and to conduct signal and track maintenance work. During this busing period, Pascack Valley Line customers from Spring Valley, Nanuet and Pearl Valley may opt to use their monthly/weekly commutation tickets on the Hudson Line for travel between Tarrytown Station and Grand Central Terminal. Regular service will resume on Mon., Nov. 2. For complete details, visit NJ TRANSIT at http://bit.ly/1WkyWpw

Buses Replace Ronkonkoma Branch Trains Today

Buses replace trains between Ronkonkoma & Hicksville today thru 12:45 AM Mon. Nov. 2 while trackwork is performed. See http://bit.ly/1GrgrOv for details. W/B customers at stations Ronkonkoma thru Pinelawn board buses up to 44 min. earlier than normal train times to Hicksville, then transfer to trains. E/B customers transfer to buses at Hicksville for stations Pinelawn thru Ronkonkoma. Bethpage & Farmingdale customers have regular train service.

New Haven Line Bridgeplate Boarding Cos Cob to Old Greenwich

New Haven Line Customers please be advised that beginning Saturday, October 31 there will be bridgeplate boarding Eastbound at Cos Cob, Riverside and Old Greenwich to accommodate necessary work in that vicinity. This project is expected to last 4 to 6 weeks. We thank you for your patience as we continue to make improvements along our right-of-way.
Weekend Busing On Pascack Valley Line, Sat., Oct. 31-Sun., Nov. 1

Buses will substitute for trains on the Pascack Valley Line between Spring Valley and Secaucus Junction for the entire weekend of Sat., Oct. 31-Sun., Nov. 1. This service change is taking place to accommodate scheduled grade crossing repairs and to conduct signal and track maintenance work. During this busing period, Pascack Valley Line customers from Spring Valley, Nanuet and Pearl Valley may opt to use their monthly/weekly commutation tickets on the Hudson Line for travel between Tarrytown Station and Grand Central Terminal. Regular service will resume on Mon., Nov. 2. For complete details, visit NJ TRANSIT at http://bit.ly/1WkyWpw

Avoid Delays on Ronkonkoma Branch Today

To avoid busing and delays on the Ronkonkoma Branch today, customers are encouraged use other LIRR branches, if possible. If traveling for the World Series or NYC Marathon, consider taking the Babylon, Far Rockaway, Hempstead, Long Beach, Montauk, Oyster Bay, Port Jefferson, Port Washington or West Hempstead Branches - which will have normal weekend schedules.
